basic_info.description: üëã Hello, my name is Aubrey Corsetti and I am a Software Developer. Before changing my career towards tech, I was a dog groomer and a solar panel salesperson. Two very different things.. fortunately from that I've learned many skills that may not be tech but I can bring into my tech career such as; time management, the ability to multitask and swift problem solving skills. I decided to go into software development because I've always been intrigued with how websites/apps are built and presented to the user as well as coming up with ways on how I would improve them. This is why I chose to specialize in Python üêç. I would love to use my skill in a fun environment that is open-minded, allows me to be creative and aims to leave a positive, memorable experience for the user. I am sure that no matter where I go in life, tech will always be a passion of mine and I am always excited to create something that will be used by many. üí´

projects.title: Jenkins Travel Agency
projects.description: This site was inspired by indecisiveness on where to travel. We created an online quiz that generates 4 destinations with quick booking links based on user input/answers. This was possible by using React, JavaScript, CSS, Auth0 and HTML5.

projects.title: Can of Books
projects.description: This site was inspired by a library. Using Auth0, I was able to ensure secure profiles for users where they are able to store all of the books that they've read and giving them the option to add, update and delete their library. To create this site I used Auth0, React, JS, HTML5, CSS, Netlify and MongoDB.

projects.title: Datesters
projects.description: This site was inspired by dates! Finding a date location within your area or any destination is now made easy. With Datesters you will will to have a fun, interactive time with a name based compatibilty test. You will also be able to save/update and delete any favorited date locations/ideas to the users profile. This was made possible with 2 APIs, React, Auth0, CSS, JavaScript, Netlify, MongoDB, and HTML.
